titlestmt.titleproper: Finding Aid for the Sue Prosin Papers LSC.2225
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Stacy Wood, 2014; Sabrina Ponce, 2018; machine-readable finding aid created by Caroline Cub√©.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

publicationstmt.date: Online finding aid last updated 15 February 2018.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2018-02-15T13:04-0800

did.abstract: Sue Prosin was a social scientist who published studies on a range of topics like butch-femme relationships and attitudes of the Jewish community toward African-Americans. She attended San Fernando Valley State College (currenty California State University, Northridge) and was also an active member of the Daughters of Bilitis. This collection contains correspondence, research materials, and various writings by Prosin. The bulk of the collection focuses on her study of butch-femme lesbian relationships between 1960 and 1965.
did.physloc: Stored off-site at SRLF. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Reproduction and Use
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical objects belong to the UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: COLLECTION STORED OFF-SITE AT SRLF: Open for research. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Sue Prosin Papers (Collection 2225). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

acqinfo.head: Provenance/Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: June Mazer Lesbian Archives, transfer, 2014. Original provenance unknown.
This collection is part of an outreach and collection-building partnership between the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives, the UCLA Center for the Study of Women (CSW), and the UCLA Library.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: Stacy Wood, 2014. Description enhanced and further physical processing completed by Sabrina Ponce in 2018.

odd.head: Sponsor
odd.p: The June L. Mazer Lesbian Archive at UCLA is an outreach and collection-building partnership between the June L. Mazer Lesbian Archives, the UCLA Center for the Study of Women (CSW), and the UCLA Library. These collections expand the pool of primary source materials available to researchers and to the community at large. This partnership was initiated by CSW and is funded by the National Endowment for the Humanities (NEH) to inventory, organize, preserve, and digitize more than eighty Mazer collections pertaining to lesbian and feminist activism and writings.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Sue Prosin was a social scientist who published studies on a range of topics like butch-femme relationships and attitudes of the Jewish community toward African-Americans. She attended San Fernando Valley State College (now California State University, Northridge) and was also an active member of the Daughters of Bilitis. The original purpose of the Daughters of Bilitis (founded in 1955) was to counteract the isolation experienced by lesbians, although the organization later focused on educating lesbians about their rights and on lobbying efforts. Prosin died in 2002.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains correspondence, research materials, and various writings by Sue Prosin. The bulk of the collection focuses on a study by Prosin of butch-femme lesbian relationships between 1960 and 1965.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: COLLECTION CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: Audiovisual materials in this collection will require assessment and possible digitization for safe access. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Daughters of Bilitis Records (Collection 1946). Available at Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, UCLA.

controlaccess.corpname: June L. Mazer Lesbian Archive at UCLA.
controlaccess.subject: Butch and femme (Lesbian culture)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Papers, drafts of papers, notes and research materials from Prosin's undergraduate course work.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Clippings of news stories concerning activism by Sue Prosin and about her mother, Frieda Trebor, the first occupational therapist in California.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Includes a flyer, notes, and a card to June Mazer and Bunny MacCulloch.

did.unittitle: Daughters of Bilitis Second National Convention

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Prosin's resume, copies of several different articles, and other materials regarding the presentation of her paper "A Study in Minority Action" at the Daughters of Bilitis Second National Convention.

did.unittitle: "The Concept of the Lesbian, a Minority in Reverse" by Sue Prosin

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Drafts, correspondences, and notes for the publication of Prosin's article, presented at the Daughters of Bilitis Second National Convention under the title of "A Study in Minority Action."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Blue Book: A Guide to Gay and Lesbian LA (1979) and LA Women's Yellow Pages (1977)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Poems, clippings, notes and personal writings of Sue Prosin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: "The Lesbian: A Study in Self-Image and Role Playing Patterns" and "The Concept of the Lesbian: A Minority in Reverse" by Sue Prosin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Contains notes on observations, research literature, research design materials, interviews with couples, data tabulation sheets, research proposals and survey materials for a study on butch-femme relationships and gendered dynamics by Sue Prosin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Includes twenty-three 1/4 inch audio reels pertaining to Prosin's butch-femme study. There is an additional audio reel container that is supposed to include the second reel of selections from Ruth Reid's "Dark Birth," but it is empty. Also includes three audiocassette tapes containing interviews with Sue Prosin.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: COLLECTION CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: Audiovisual materials in this collection will require assessment and possible digitization for safe access. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.
